author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tension gripped the office of the primary education department when the court officials on Wednesday initiated distraint proceedings against it as it failed to pay compensation to an accident victim.

Road worker Sathish Kumar (33) of V. Chithoor was killed on the spot in 2009 when the department jeep knocked him down when he was returning from office.

On hearing an accident claim petition filed by his wife S. Satya, the court directed the primary education department to pay a compensation of Rs. 17 lakh to her.

The office settled only a part of the claim and kept the remaining amount pending for long. It made the petitioner run from pillar to post for getting the money.

She approached the court again and filed a contempt petition. The court ordered distraint proceedings against the department, and confiscation of three jeeps, a car, bureaus, computers and fans from the office.

When court officials went to the office in the morning, the education department officials assured them that they would pay the remaining amount to the victim’s wife within 15 days.

A worker was killed when department jeep knocked him down when he was returning from office
title: Distraint proceedings against govt. office
